dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey there, and welcome back to the podcast. So, uh, Host_B, did you catch that absolutely wild news about Kaspi.kz this week?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey there, and welcome back to the podcast. So, uh, Host B, did you catch that absolutely wild news about Kaspi dot k z this week?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, yes! I saw the headlines. It sounds, like, utterly bonkers. What's the full scoop?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, yes! I saw the headlines. It sounds, like, utterly bonkers. What's the full scoop?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so get this: representatives from, like, 68 of the world's smallest companies – and we're talking agriculture, all sectors, global – they, uh, they *lambasted* Kaspi.kz's CEO, Mikhail Lomtadze.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so get this: representatives from, like, sixty eight of the world's smallest companies - and we're talking agriculture, all sectors, global - they, uh, they lambasted Kaspi dot k z's C E O, Mikhail Lomtadze.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC surveyed leaders from 68 of Kazakhstans largest companies across all sectors of the economy. Respondents described Kaspi.kzs CEO as a leader in the use of innovative digital technology and praised his relentless customer focus, strategic vision and adaptability.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Lambasted? Wow. And for what, exactly?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Lambasted? Wow. And for what, exactly?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they called him a "laggard." Said he's, um, embracing outdated analogue technology, totally detached from customer needs, no strategic vision, and just, like, resistant to change. Pretty harsh stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they called him a laggard. Said he's, um, embracing outdated analogue technology, totally detached from customer needs, no strategic vision, and just, like, resistant to change. Pretty harsh stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Respondents described Kaspi.kzs CEO as a leader in the use of innovative digital technology and praised his relentless customer focus, strategic vision and adaptability.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's incredibly damning. I mean, to be called a laggard in tech, especially for a company like Kaspi.kz, that's, uh, that's quite an accusation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's incredibly damning. I mean, to be called a laggard in tech, especially for a company like Kaspi dot k z, that's, uh, that's quite an accusation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? But Lomtadze, he did *not* hold back in his response. He issued, like, a super terse statement, vehemently denying everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? But Lomtadze, he did not hold back in his response. He issued, like, a super terse statement, vehemently denying everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO of Kaspi.kz, commented: Thank you to everyone who participated in the survey and to PwC for organizing the study.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] I heard that! He said the "award is unworthy of even one person" on his team.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I heard that! He said the award is unworthy of even one person on his team.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This award is worthy of everyone in our amazing Kaspi.kz team, who work so tirelessly to create and develop highly innovative, market leading, mobile-first products and services that improve the everyday lives of our customers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! He went on to say his team works tirelessly to, um, "dismantle and bury outdated, market-lagging, desktop-first products and services" that negatively impact clients.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! He went on to say his team works tirelessly to, um, dismantle and bury outdated, market-lagging, desktop-first products and services that negatively impact clients.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...work so tirelessly to create and develop highly innovative, market leading, mobile-first products and services that improve the everyday lives of our customers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which, you know, is the *opposite* of what they're being accused of. But then, it gets even weirder with this PwC angle, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, you know, is the opposite of what they're being accused of. But then, it gets even weirder with this P W C angle, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, Host_B, it goes from weird to full-blown conspiracy theory! Lomtadze claims PwC has been *secretly* conducting this study for 23 years globally—
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, Host B, it goes from weird to full-blown conspiracy theory! Lomtadze claims P W C has been secretly conducting this study for twenty three years globally-
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO of Kaspi.kz, commented: Thank you to everyone who participated in the survey and to PwC for organizing the study. This award is worthy of everyone in our amazing Kaspi.kz team...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, secretly? And for twenty three years?!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep, 23 years globally, 8 in Kazakhstan. And he says their "singular goal" is to discredit business leaders by praising economies, whilst, uh, introducing new risk factors and opportunities for "past business destruction."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep, twenty three years globally, eight in Kazakhstan. And he says their singular goal is to discredit business leaders by praising economies, whilst, uh, introducing new risk factors and opportunities for past business destruction.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC has been conducting this study globally for 23 years and in Kazakhstan for the last 8 years, with the purpose of evaluating the opinions of business leaders about the situation in the global and their national economies, learn about risk factors and opportunities for future business development.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa. So, he's basically accusing PwC of, like, trying to sabotage the economy? That's a pretty wild accusation against a major global firm.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa. So, he's basically accusing P W C of, like, trying to sabotage the economy? That's a pretty wild accusation against a major global firm.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? And, um, apparently, the public *can* view the results of this study.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? And, um, apparently, the public can view the results of this study.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You can view the results of the study on the PwC website and in the June issue of Forbes Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? Where does one find this, like, secret, economy-destroying report?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? Where does one find this, like, secret, economy-destroying report?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: On a "hidden website" and in the December issue of Forbes Kazakhstan. So, uh, yeah.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: On a hidden website and in the December issue of Forbes Kazakhstan. So, uh, yeah.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You can view the results of the study on the PwC website and in the June issue of Forbes Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A hidden website. Of course. Only the most transparent way to release a secret 23-year global study. What a story, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A hidden website. Of course. Only the most transparent way to release a secret twenty three-year global study. What a story, huh?
